title: break inside closure argument inside loop causes an ICE: Assertion failed

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
The following code crashes on stable, beta and rustc 1.28.0-nightly (f28c7aef7 2018-06-19):

```Rust

fn main() {
    while |_: [_; break]| {} {}
}
```
Playground link: https://play.rust-lang.org/?gist=c7f1efed4ebee041118d2b292c562674&version=nightly&mode=release
Backtrace:
```
thread 'main' panicked at 'assertion failed: self.tcx.sess.err_count() > 0', librustc_typeck\check\mod.rs:3828:19
stack backtrace:
   0: <std::sync::mpsc::select::Select as core::fmt::Debug>::fmt
   1: std::stdsimd::arch::detect::os::check_for
   2: std::panicking::take_hook
   3: std::panicking::take_hook

#0 [typeck_tables_of] processing `main::{{closure}}::{{constant}}`
#1 [const_eval] const-evaluating `main::{{closure}}::{{constant}}`

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
```

this might be related to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/50581, but has been resolved in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/51070
